External domains or URLs identified via.Action: Ingest threat intelligence feeds containing known suspicious domains/URLs (typosquats, C2s, known phishing sites) into Zeek's intel framework. Monitor Zeek intel.log for matches against internal DNS queries (dns.log). Analyze frequency and origin of internal systems attempting to resolve flagged external resources. Use correlation analysis to link lookups to specific internal users or events.

Discovery of externally hosted web conte.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log for connections to domains/URLs flagged by external threat intelligence or OSINT as hosting malicious content. Analyze HTTP request details, user agents, and potential file downloads. Correlate with security alerts from web filters or network sandboxes if available. Use linear regression or time series analysis to model baseline outbound HTTP traffic to known sites and identify deviations related to connections to suspicious external sites.

Internal user access attempts to newly r.Action: Identify newly registered or recently active domains related to the organization or its vendors (e.g., via OSINT sources like WHOIS). Correlate internal DNS queries (Zeek dns.log) or HTTP connections (Zeek http.log) to these domains. Analyze the frequency of access attempts per internal host/user using descriptive statistics. Use correlation analysis to identify multiple users accessing the same suspicious new domain, which could indicate a widespread phishing attempt.

Internal user access attempts to suspici.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log for connections to domains associated with frequently abused services (e.g., bit.ly, rebrand.ly, specific free hosting domains, PaaS domains like *.web.core.windows.net). Filter for requests with unusually long, random-looking, or highly specific path/query string components (potential unique URIs). Analyze the frequency of access to such URLs per internal user. Use entropy measures on URL path/query strings accessed by users to identify highly entropic (potentially generated) links accessed frequently.
